metadata.synopsis: Gale speaks with his love interest player in a private bedroom upstairs at an inn. They've saved the world and just spent the night together. Now they take a moment to discuss what's in store for them. Gale will either:- Wish to retrieve a powerful (and dangerous) artefact that was lost during the climactic battle- Wish to return to his life in Waterdeep.

49.speaker: Gale
49.text: It's curious. After all the wonders and monstrosities we've witnessed, waking beside you seems more unreal than any of it.
49.context: NodeContext: Wistful/peaceful - spent a romantic night with the person he loves

101.speaker: Gale
101.text: I'd forgotten what it felt like, to greet a sunrise without fear of it being my last.

137.speaker: Gale
137.text: It's curious. After all the wonders and monstrosities we've witnessed, waking beside you seems more unreal than any of it.
137.context: NodeContext: Wistful/peaceful - spent a romantic night with the person he loves

117.speaker: Gale
117.text: I'd forgotten what it felt like, to greet a sunrise without fear of it being my last.

151.speaker: Gale
151.text: It's curious. After all the wonders and monstrosities we've witnessed, waking beside you seems more unreal than any of it.
151.context: NodeContext: Wistful/peaceful - spent a romantic night with the person he loves

23.speaker: Gale
23.text: I'd forgotten what it felt like, to greet a sunrise without fear of it being my last.

33.speaker: Gale
33.text: Oh, hells. I'm sorry. Barely awake a moment and I've already put my foot in it.
33.context: NodeContext: Kicking himself, he's accidentally rubbed salt in his partner's very sore wound

150.speaker: Player
150.text: Don't be. At least one of us will get the cure we were hoping for.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Don't be. It's not your fault.

146.speaker: Gale
146.text: Come now - resignation doesn't suit you half as well as optimism. We'll find some other means of fixing up that infernal engine of yours.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: Knowing you, I'd expect nothing less.

11.speaker: Gale
11.text: You always find a smile where others would soak in their sorrows. And I promise - you'll have reason to smile soon enough.

94.speaker: Gale
94.text: When we get to Waterdeep, we'll search in my library. It's bound to contain the odd scroll on hellish thermodynamics. Or a spell that might diffuse the heat in such a way that -

126.speaker: Gale
126.text: Ah. But I'm getting ahead of myself. Do you... that is, would you consider returning to Waterdeep with me?
126.context: NodeContext: A bit nervous to ask - this is Karlach, after all

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I can't. My only hope of survival is to return to Avernus - and I'm not going back.

20.speaker: Gale
20.text: What, then? You intend to die here? Now?
20.context: NodeContext: Refuses to believe it - essentially been told his partner is submitting to her illness

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I'd love to, Gale, but I can't. My engine is done. Fully cooked.

8.speaker: Gale
8.text: I - I don't believe it. I won't believe it.

102.speaker: Gale
102.text: If you go were to return to the hells - temporarily - it would buy us some time. I could put something together, a means of keeping you stable at least. Please, let me try.
102.context: NodeContext: Trying to convince her, scared by what she's saying (that she's ready to die)

103.speaker: Player
103.text: And hand myself to Zariel on a platter? No thanks.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I'm not going back, Gale. I can't.

110.speaker: Gale
110.text: What if... what if I went with you?
110.context: NodeContext: Scared by his own suggestion

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I couldn't let you do that. You deserve better.

86.speaker: Gale
86.text: I deserve the chance to live my life with the raging inferno I love. If that means relocating to the hells, so be it. I've heard Avernus is quite lovely this time of year.

120.speaker: Gale
120.text: Besides, it would be quite something to study infernal magic in its natural environs. I say 'natural' in the loosest sense, of course.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: If you were with me, I might be able to handle it.

56.speaker: Gale
56.text: There's nothing we can't handle - I promise you that.
56.context: NodeContext: Essentially his partner just refused treatment for a terminal illness. He's putting a brave face on it so they can enjoy the time they have left.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: No, Gale. Neither of us is going to that pit. It all ends here. Now. I just want to see the sky one last time.

29.speaker: Gale
29.text: If this is the end, then we face it together. That, at least, I can promise you.
29.context: NodeContext: Heartbroken - his lover is dying next to him, thanking her for loving him

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Say nothing. Concentrate. You feel like you might explode any second.

21.speaker: Gale
21.text: I know that look. It's your heart isn't it? Not to worry - you have one of the finest wizards in the Realms at your fingertips.

96.speaker: Gale
96.text: Soon, I'll deliver the crown to Mystra, and be rid of the orb at long last. I'll be free.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: And what does freedom mean, for Gale of Waterdeep?

50.speaker: Gale
50.text: Oh, him. I've been thinking a lot about that. 'Gale of Waterdeep', sounds a bit... pompous, don't you think?

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Free to come back to bed...

37.speaker: Gale
37.text: We have all the time in the world for that. But first, there's something I wanted to talk to you about.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I'm excited to meet this new you.

68.speaker: Gale
68.text: I do feel like a new man. I was going to speak to you about that, as a matter of fact.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: You're lucky. I wish my own condition were so easily cured.

52.speaker: Gale
52.text: Whatever for? I rather like this new you.

89.speaker: Gale
89.text: In fact, your tentacular transformation has inspired me to make a little change of my own.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: You seem very relaxed. The orb isn't on the verge of exploding yet then?

73.speaker: Gale
73.text: It's strange, but somehow I woke up this morning and realised the orb feels different. No clamour, no desperation, no hunger.
73.context: NodeContext: 'And mine...' leading into explanation of his 'new dawn' on the next line

152.speaker: Gale
152.text: I hesitate to say it, but I think it's... satisfied.

45.speaker: Gale
45.text: I'll need to keep a careful study of it, make sure it's not suddenly destabilised by proximity to a rogue pair of Netherese sandals or what have you, but I think it's dormant.

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: That's one worry I can leave behind me, at least.
28.context: NodeContext: Hint of nerves, he's about to ask you to marry him...

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Was it Mystra's doing, do you think?

60.speaker: Gale
60.text: It could be. Or perhaps the orb's hunger was fuelled by my own, and my contentment influences it in much the same way.

19.speaker: Gale
19.text: That's how I feel with you - content. It's a rather unfamiliar feeling, I must say. Not something Gale of Waterdeep ever craved.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: You don't seem all that excited. Is something the matter?

97.speaker: Gale
97.text: Not the matter, but there is a matter I wanted to speak to you about.

14.speaker: Gale
14.text: I've decided to drop this whole 'Gale of Waterdeep' business. It's a bit... pompous, don't you think?

147.speaker: Player
147.text: That's a relief. Can't say I was thrilled at the prospect of chasing you around the Sword Coast snacking on trinkets.

129.speaker: Gale
129.text: Quite. Though on the subject of our future plans, there was something I wanted to discuss with you.

0.speaker: Gale
0.text: I thought I might take this opportunity to reinvent myself. Or uninvent myself, to be more accurate.

54.speaker: Gale
54.text: You're now in the company of plain old Gale Dekarios - a most brilliant wizard of intentionally limited renown. At your service.
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale bows/presents himself as though introducing himself to the playerNodeContext: Introducing himself wiht some flair

22.speaker: Gale
22.text: Now, I believe this is the moment where I should get to my point, so to speak.

115.speaker: Gale
115.text: I love you, more than I've ever loved anyone, mortal or immortal. And you've proven your love for me in more ways than even the greatest mathematicians would dare to count.

82.speaker: Gale
82.text: That being said, I wondered if you might consider accompanying me back to Waterdeep as a new member of the Dekarios clan?
82.context: NodeContext: Nervous, he's promosing marriage, in a roundabout way

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Are you asking me to marry you?

1.speaker: Gale
1.text: I suppose I am. Tara would be delighted. Not to mention my mother. But I'd be just as happy without such ceremony, so long as we're together.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: You'd really wish to marry me, in my present condition?

35.speaker: Gale
35.text: Your 'present condition' is that you're the one I love. And your current form is merely a reflection of the depths of your sacrifice. It only makes me love you more.

4.speaker: Gale
4.text: There will be some practicalities to iron out. The guest list, the venue, and we'll need to find a very open-minded cleric.

133.speaker: Gale
133.text: I promise we'll make it work, if you'll have me?

106.speaker: Player
106.text: I'll marry you, but I can't live in Waterdeep.

138.speaker: Gale
138.text: Then I go where you go. Waterdeep wouldn't be home without you, anyway.

61.speaker: Gale
61.text: We'll need time to make the arrangements, of course. The catering alone will need to be quite extraordinary...
61.context: NodeContext: Reference to 'catering' because player is now a mindflayer and therefore eats brains

72.speaker: Gale
72.text: The day is young, and there are thousands more days ahead of us.

59.speaker: Gale
59.text: The day is young, and there are thousands more days ahead of us.

55.speaker: Gale
55.text: The day is young, and there are thousands more days ahead of us.

155.speaker: Gale
155.text: The day is young, and there are thousands more days ahead of us.

124.speaker: Gale
124.text: The day is young, and there are thousands more days ahead of us.

64.speaker: Gale
64.text: We'll need time to make the arrangements of course - the Dekarios clan is scattered clan far and wide, and you'll have invites of your own to send out, I'm sure.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I accept. I'll marry you, Gale Dekarios.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: I accept. I'll marry you, Gale Dekarios.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Of course I will. On one condition: we adopt any children.

93.speaker: Gale
93.text: You will? Oh, thank goodness for that.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Our relationship is perfect as it is. But Waterdeep sounds like fun.

84.speaker: Gale
84.text: You can't blame a fellow for trying. If you're contented as we are, then so am I.

149.speaker: Gale
149.text: That does lead me to a more pressing matter. Exactly how large is your library?

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I love you, but I think the vampire spawn in the Underdark need me.

130.speaker: Gale
130.text: It's taken me long enough to find you. I'll be damned if I'm letting you go.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I'm sorry, Gale. You'll have to return to Waterdeep alone. I've my own path to follow.

156.speaker: Gale
156.text: There remains only one matter to be resolved - for me, at least.

66.speaker: Gale
66.text: I understand your purpose lies here, but I fear if I return to Waterdeep alone, my heart would remain here with you.

57.speaker: Gale
57.text: And so, if you're at all amenable to the idea, I thought I could, perhaps, stay. There might even be room for two Dekarioses in Baldur's Gate?

139.speaker: Player
139.text: You'd really wish to marry me, in my present condition?

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I accept. I'll marry you, Gale Dekarios.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I accept. The Vampire Ascendant would do well to have a Consort for his Palace.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: All the ducal heraldry has already been drawn up... I'll go for 'Dekarios-Ravengard' if you will.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: My Lady would not permit such a union, but it sounds wonderful, to remain close to one another.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I've no interest in marriage. But life with you in Baldur's Gate sounds wonderful.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I'm sorry, Gale. I need to make my own life here. It's time you returned to Waterdeep.

90.speaker: Gale
90.text: I see. Well, I've no desire to stand in the way of the future you've chosen.
90.context: NodeContext: disappointed but accepts it because he loves you

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: If our love ends here, it was no less perfect for its brevity. I will remember it, and you, always.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: You're lucky. I wish my own condition were so easily cured.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I could get used to that feeling.

25.speaker: Gale
25.text: I think we'll have plenty of time to do just that.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Wake me up this early again, and you won't see many more...

80.speaker: Gale
80.text: Not a morning person, I take it? I can scratch that from the list of wonderfully ordinary things I've still to learn about you.

99.speaker: Gale
99.text: I'm not normally one to rise with the birds myself, but something disturbed my sleep.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: It's equally strange to wake and feel the sun on this body. I'm not sure what to make of it.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Sure, rub it in why don't you...

77.speaker: Gale
77.text: Both of us have been blessed with a new dawn - you should feel no shame at the nature of yours. And mine...
